result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin Jones

records.addlTxt: Defendant Calvin Jones in court.   Assistant District Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin.   The defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Court appoints Attorney Michael Plaisted as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Plaisted accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing at the completion of the case, until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept.  Case is adjourned in Br 45 for scheduling.   mn

Defendant Calvin Jones in court.  Prosecuting attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for the State of Wisconsin for Jack Eichorst.  The defendant advised the court he wants to hire an attorney.  The Court will allow an additional pretrial conference to allow for an appearance by counsel.  Case adjourned in Br 45.  mn
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SB, Manpower located at 823 N. Mayfair Road.

Defendant Calvin Jones in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/8/22 @ 2p
